org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch

Class StrongWolfeInterpolationLineSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch.IterativeLineSearch
      • org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch.StrongWolfeInterpolationLineSearch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LineSearch

    public final class StrongWolfeInterpolationLineSearch
extends IterativeLineSearch
    Implements an interpolation based line search algorithm that returns a step size value that satisfies the strong Wolfe conditions. This is an implementation of algorithms 3.5 and 3.6, described in pages 60-62 of the book "Numerical Optimization", by Jorge Nocedal and Stephen Wright.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

      Maximum number of allowed line search iterations with no improvement in the objective function value.
      private static double MINIMUM_DISTANCE_FROM_INTERVAL_ENDPOINTS
      Threshold for the minimum allowed distance between a new step size value, computed using a cubic interpolation approach, and the allowed step size values interval endpoints.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StrongWolfeInterpolationLineSearch

        public StrongWolfeInterpolationLineSearch(AbstractFunction objective,
                                          double c1,
                                          double c2,
                                          double aMax)
        Constructs a strong Wolfe interpolation based line search solver for the provided objective function instance and using the provided parameters.
        Parameters:
        objective - The objective function instance.
        c1 - The proportionality constant used for the first of the two Wolfe conditions (that is, the Armijo condition). The value provided must lie between 0 and 1.
        c2 - The proportionality constant used for the second of the two Wolfe conditions (that is, the curvature condition). The value provided must lie between c1 and 1.
        aMax - The maximum allowed value for the step size.

    • Method Detail

      • performLineSearch

        public double performLineSearch(Vector point,
                                Vector direction)
        Perform the actual line search after an initial value for the step size has been selected. The IterativeLineSearch.initialStepSize must have been initialized before this method is called.
        Specified by:
        performLineSearch in class IterativeLineSearch
        Parameters:
        point - The point at which we perform the line search.
        direction - The direction for which we perform the line search.
        Returns:
        A step size value that satisfies the strong Wolfe conditions.

      • zoom

        private double zoom(Vector point,
                    Vector direction,
                    double aLow,
                    double aHigh)
        This function "zooms in" in the interval [aLow, aHigh] and searches for a step size within that interval that satisfies the strong Wolfe conditions. In each iteration the interval of possible values for the step size is "shrinked" and a new value to test is chosen each time using cubic interpolation. aLow and aHigh are such that:

        • The interval bounded by aLow and aHigh contains step lengths that satisfy the strong Wolfe conditions.
        • Among all step sizes generated so far and satisfying the Armijo condition (also known as the sufficient decrease condition), aLow is the one giving the smallest function value.
        • aHigh is chosen so that φ'(aLow)(aHigh - aLow) < 0.

        Each iteration of this function generates a new step size, between aLow and aLow and then replaces one of these endpoints by that new step size, in such a way that the above mentioned properties continue to hold. Once a step size value satisfying the strong Wolfe conditions has been found, that value is returned.

        Note that aLow does not necessarily have to be smaller than aHigh.
        Parameters:
        point - The point at which we perform the line search.
        direction - The direction for which we perform the line search.
        aLow - One of the two endpoints of the interval of possible values for the step size.
        aHigh - One of the two endpoints of the interval of possible values for the step size.
        Returns:
        A step size value that lies in the interval [aLow, aHigh] and satisfies the strong Wolfe conditions.

      • performCubicInterpolation

        private double performCubicInterpolation(Vector point,
                                         Vector direction,
                                         double aLow,
                                         double aHigh)
        Performs a cubic interpolation using the available information in order to obtain an approximation of the φ function and returns the step size value, in the interval [aLow, aHigh], that minimizes that approximation.
        Parameters:
        point - The point at which we perform the line search.
        direction - The direction for which we perform the line search.
        aLow - One of the two endpoints of the interval of possible values for the step size.
        aHigh - One of the two endpoints of the interval of possible values for the step size.
        Returns:
        A point in the interval [aLow, aHigh] that minimizes a cubic interpolation approximation of the φ function computed using available information.
